chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto C Ramirez Delgado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 152 days credit served.

5/31/2017 - COURT GRANTS REQUEST TO MODIFY SENTENCE CREDIT TO A TOTAL OF 182 DAYS.

superMiscConds.notes:
All costs, DNA surcharge and Child Pornography surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and out of Prison wages.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16.
Cooperate with any therapy recommended.
Use of any computer to be monitored.
Comply with Sex Offender registration.
Assessed for any Sex Offender needs.
Provide DNA sample if not already done and pay surcharge and costs.

Return of Amended Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Roberto C Ramirez Delgado in court, in custody.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  The Court calls the case to address the letter filed by the Defendant requesting additional sentence credit.  The State does not object.  The Court grants the Defendant's request for additional sentence credit.  The Court will amend the judgment of conviction for reflect a total of amend182 days credit.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 5/31/17 at 8:30 a.m.
Review hearing on May 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

From State dated 1/24/17 responding to Court's request; State's position is 182 days credit.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 1/25/17; Schedule hearing to address, unless there is a stipulation to amend the joc with the correct number of days.
To State requesting response by 1/30/17.

Defendant Roberto C Ramirez Delgado in court, in custody, with Attorney Jon Alfonso Lamendola.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Dawn Maldonado, interpreter.   
Interpreter, sworn.
Court reads the recommendation/agreement for sentencing.   State explains surcharge regarding photos.  State made further sentencing statements.
Attorney Lamendola made sentencing statements.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:
6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 152 days )
- 3 Years of Initial Confinement
- 3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No unsupervised contact with children under 16;
- Cooperate with any therapy recommended; 
- Use of any computer to be monitored
- Sex offender registration;
- Assessed for any sex offender needs;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;


Cost: $268.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00
Image Surcharge:  $1,500.00
(To be paid as a condition of extended supervision and out of prison wages)  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
